Dear Mr. ___,

I hope this letter finds you in good health. I am writing to summarize your recent hospital stay for the management of pneumonia. You were admitted on February 10, 2024, and discharged on February 14, 2024.

Upon admission, you presented with symptoms including cough, shortness of breath, hemoptysis, and fever. Initial tests and a chest X-ray confirmed a diagnosis of lobar pneumonia with consolidation in the left lower lobe. At that time, your vital signs indicated a mild fever of 38.5°C and an oxygen saturation of 92%.

Throughout your stay, we monitored vital parameters and conducted regular laboratory tests. Your C-reactive protein (CRP) levels decreased consistently from 60 mg/L at admission to 20 mg/L by the day before discharge, reflecting a positive response to treatment. White blood cell count also improved, indicating reduced inflammation.

Dr. Smith initiated prompt treatment with intravenous Amoxicillin and supportive medication such as Paracetamol for fever management. Your condition showed steady improvement with the therapy, and the decision was made to transition to oral Amoxicillin after stabilization.

By the time of discharge, significant improvements were seen in your health markers. Your temperature had normalized, and oxygen saturation levels were well within normal limits at 98%. Dr. Smith declared you medically fit for discharge on February 14, 2024. 

As per the discharge plan, you are advised to continue oral Amoxicillin for the next five days. It is crucial to complete the full course of antibiotics to ensure the infection is entirely resolved. A follow-up appointment has been scheduled at the outpatient clinic in two weeks to evaluate your recovery.

Should you have any questions or experience any new or worsening symptoms, please contact the clinic promptly. It has been a pleasure caring for you during your recovery, and we look forward to seeing you at your follow-up visit.

Wishing you a full and rapid recovery.

Warm regards,

Dr. ___
